metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0854 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.Description: A memory leak flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s DMA subsystem, in theway a user calls DMA_FROM_DEVICE. This flaw allows a local user to readrandom memory from the kernel space.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
